news.headline: Amazon Is Better Prepared for the Trade War Than Investors Think
news.summary: Amazon’s  retail business is particularly affected by the escalating trade battle with China, which currently includes a 145% tariff on imports to the U.S. Around 25% of products Amazon directly sells originate in China, Morgan Stanley estimates.  The company’s large logistics footprint and relationships with global suppliers mean it can move inventory and production to countries not as hard hit by tariffs.  The company canceled some vendor orders from China after the tariffs went into effect, a prelude, potentially, to a geographic shift.
